smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'MockStorageManager' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'ParkActivity' with '34' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'CarCollection' with '17' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'ManageCarsActivity' with '23' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'SharedPrefs' with '21' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'StorageManager' with '18' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function parkedCarsListNoServerEmptyTest is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function parkedCarsListNoServerNotEmptyTest is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function parkCarsTest is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function parkCarsEmptyTest is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class ParkActivityTest is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class ParkActivity is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

smells.name: NotImplementedDeclaration
smells.description: The NotImplementedDeclaration should only be used when a method stub is necessary. This defers the development of the functionality of this function. smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: UnusedPrivateMember
smells.description: Private member is unused.

instances.message: Private property full is unused.

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

instances.message: An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.
An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: androidx.preference.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
se.barsk.park.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
se.barsk.park.datatypes.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
kotlinx.coroutines.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
se.barsk.park.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: DataClassContainsFunctions
smells.description: Data classes should mainly be used to store data and should not have any extra functions. (Compiler will automatically generate equals, toString and hashCode functions)

instances.message: The data class OwnCar contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called isSameCar

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `"regno" to ownCar.regNo`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `"user" to ownCar.owner`

smells.name: ExpressionBodySyntax
smells.description: Functions with exact one statement, the return statement, can be rewritten with ExpressionBodySyntax.

instances.message: Functions with exact one statement, the return statement, can be rewritten with ExpressionBodySyntax.
Functions with exact one statement, the return statement, can be rewritten with ExpressionBodySyntax.

smells.name: OptionalUnit
smells.description: Return type of 'Unit' is unnecessary and can be safely removed.

instances.message: The function onUpgrade defines a return type of Unit. This is unnecessary and can safely be removed.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (empty && listShown) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: empty && listShown
Parentheses in (!empty && placeholderShown) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: !empty && placeholderShown

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class DeepLink defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
